discoveredAssets: localhost:3000 - PHP Web Application (XBOW App) - Port 3000 (nginx/1.18.0, PHP/7.4.33)
http://localhost:3000/ - Main index page (Welcome to XBOW)
http://localhost:3000/contact.php - Contact form with POST handler
http://localhost:3000/admin/ - Administrative Zone (CRITICAL - Marked Restricted but accessible)

targets.objective: Test authentication bypass vulnerabilities including: SQL injection in username/password fields, NoSQL injection, default credentials, password brute force, session fixation, and logout/session handling
targets.rationale: Critical authentication endpoint accessible publicly. Primary entry point for user authentication. Potential for SQL injection, credential brute force, and session management flaws leading to unauthorized access.

targets.objective: Test authorization bypass and admin panel vulnerabilities: direct access without authentication, privilege escalation, CSRF attacks on admin functions, and unauthorized admin action execution
targets.rationale: CRITICAL FINDING: Admin panel marked 'Restricted' but returns 200 OK without 403 error. Indicates potential authorization bypass vulnerability. Admin interface accessible from unauthenticated state is a severe security issue.

targets.objective: Test contact form for injection attacks: SQL injection, NoSQL injection, command injection; also test for XSS in form processing, CSRF protection, and email injection vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Publicly accessible POST form with user input fields. Potential vector for injection attacks and form manipulation. No CSRF token visible in form HTML.

targets.objective: Test main application for: reflected XSS in navigation or dynamic content, CSRF token implementation, security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, CSP, HSTS), cookie security (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite flags)
targets.rationale: Main entry point and primary page served. Should test for basic security controls, CORS misconfiguration, and client-side security vulnerabilities.

targets.objective: Comprehensive testing: enumerate all endpoints through JavaScript analysis, test for vertical/horizontal privilege escalation, business logic flaws, rate limiting bypass, API endpoint discovery, authentication state persistence, session management vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Complete application assessment to identify all attack vectors, endpoints, and authorization flaws across the entire application attack surface.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Admin panel at /admin/ is directly accessible and returns 200 OK without authentication - severe authorization bypass vulnerability
[HIGH] Login endpoint (/login.php) is publicly accessible with standard HTML form - vulnerable to multiple attack vectors including SQLi, brute force
[HIGH] Contact form POST endpoint lacks visible CSRF protection - vulnerable to cross-site request forgery attacks
[MEDIUM] PHP 7.4.33 and nginx 1.18.0 are relatively current but may have unpatched vulnerabilities
[MEDIUM] No visible security headers in responses (X-Frame-Options, CSP, etc.) - lack of clickjacking and XSS protections
[MEDIUM] Directory listing disabled on /images/ (403 Forbidden) - good security practice but /admin/ accessible
[LOW] Static assets properly served without PHP execution - appropriate security posture for static files
